Signs and symptoms of a brain infarct caused by cocaine overdose may include:

* Sudden severe headache or confusion disorientation)
* Weakness or numbness in the face, arm, or leg on one side of the body)
* Difficulty with speech, vision, or balance coordination)
* Nausea and vomiting dizziness, or fainting)
* Seizures (in some cases)

If you suspect someone has had a brain infarct due to cocaine overdose, call emergency services immediately.
